messages.subject: Re: Meisho
messages.msgSnippet: Hi. You will have to show the context which includes that word.But If it reffers to the Emperor Meisho,She was a daughter of the Emperor Gomizunoo and Tokugawa
messages.messageBody:
Hi.
You will have to show the context which includes that word.But If it
reffers to the Emperor Meisho,She was a daughter of the Emperor
Gomizunoo and Tokugawa Masako,who was the daughter of Tokugawa
Hidetada(the 2nd shogun of Edo Shogunate).

Another possibility is that it means "famous generals" as Tony said.

Hope this helps

Shinsei

--- In samuraihistory@y..., Talon11339@a... wrote:
> Greetings,
> My friend is taking an intro to Japan course at UT Austin
and he
> missed a lecture because he was sick that day. We found out all
the info
> that he missed except one vocabulary word. If anyone one call tell
us who or
> what a Meisho is from the feudal era of Japanese history ASAP, it
would be
> greatly appreciated.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Meisho
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings Josh, From what I ve seen, and you can check this website out for yourself... at http://www.scaruffi.com/politics/japanese.html  it is a timeline of
messages.messageBody:
Greetings Josh,
From what I've seen, and you can check this website out for yourself... at http://www.scaruffi.com/politics/japanese.html it is a timeline of Japan.
It says that Meshio was an emperor between 1630-1643. I believe that might be the answer you are looking for.

Christine
Talon11339@... wrote:Greetings,
My friend is taking an intro to Japan course at UT Austin and he
missed a lecture because he was sick that day. We found out all the info
that he missed except one vocabulary word. If anyone one call tell us who or
what a Meisho is from the feudal era of Japanese history ASAP, it would be
greatly appreciated.

-Josh

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Meisho
messages.msgSnippet: ... Famous general -- e.g., Takeda Shingen, Oda Nobunaga, Uesugi Kenshin, Minamoto no Yoshitsune... Tony
messages.messageBody:
Talon11339@... wrote:

> Greetings,
> My friend is taking an intro to Japan course at UT Austin and he
> missed a lecture because he was sick that day. We found out all the info
> that he missed except one vocabulary word. If anyone one call tell us who or
> what a Meisho is from the feudal era of Japanese history ASAP, it would be
> greatly appreciated.

"Famous general" -- e.g., Takeda Shingen, Oda Nobunaga, Uesugi Kenshin, Minamoto
no Yoshitsune...


Tony

messages.subject: Meisho
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings, My friend is taking an intro to Japan course at UT Austin and he missed a lecture because he was sick that day.  We found out all the info that he
messages.messageBody:
Greetings,
My friend is taking an intro to Japan course at UT Austin and he
missed a lecture because he was sick that day. We found out all the info
that he missed except one vocabulary word. If anyone one call tell us who or
what a Meisho is from the feudal era of Japanese history ASAP, it would be
greatly appreciated.

-Josh
